intro: Amsinckia platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
